description:
Assuming direct DB access is in use (instead of using conductor), a nova service (thread) may be blocked for an extended period during DB access if (1) the service successfully established a DB connection and (2) the connection became broken (e.g., due to a network partition fault between the nova service and the DB backend) when the service was trying to issue a SQL statement to the DB backend. 

Our experiment showed that in such cases, the nova service (the thread issuing the DB statement) can be blocked for about 930 seconds. A timeout needs to be associated to such operations from OpenStack to achieve better control.
title: timeout control on DB access is missing

comments.content: I agree that this would be very useful, but I suspect it'll be tricky to get right in a portable way.  So it's probably too late to squeeze this into Havana, but we should give it a try for Icehouse.

* AND add the detailed steps to reproduce the issue (if applicable)
